children.name: advise
children.definition: to tell sb what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about sth:
examples: She needed someone to advise her.
‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
I'd advisewaitinguntil tomorrow.
She advised uswhen to come.
Youwould be well-advisedto(= It would be wise for you to) have the appropriate vaccinations before you go abroad.

children.name: advise sb on/about sth
examples: Your teacher will be able to advise you about what qualifications you will need.

children.name: advise sb to do sth
examples: Evans advised him to leave London.
You arestrongly advisedto take out medical insurance when visiting China.

children.name: advise sb against (doing) sth
examples: I’d advise you against saying anything to the press.

children.name: advise that
examples: Experts advise that sunscreen be reapplied every one to two hours.

children.name: advise caution/patience/restraint etc(= advise people to be careful, patient etc )
examples: The makers advise extreme caution when handling this material.

children.name: strongly advise
examples: I strongly advise you to get medical insurance if you’re going skiing.

children.name: say sb should do sth
children.definition: /ought to do something to tell sb what you think they should do, especially when this is your own personal opinion and not the result of particular information or knowledge:
examples: My friends keep saying I ought to learn to drive.
Her mother said she should call the police immediately.ngay lập tức.
They say you should drink at least eight glasses of water a day.

children.name: tell
children.definition: to tell someone that you think they should do something, especially in order to avoid problems: khuyên bảo

children.name: tell sb to do sth
examples: Dad told me to talk to a teacher if I was being bullied.
I told him to go and see a doctor if he was worried.
I told her not to worry.

children.name: tell sb (that) they should do sth
examples: Jimmy has told him he should keep away from the gang for the next couple of weeks.

children.name: suggest
children.definition: to tell sb your ideas about what they should do, where they should go etc: đề nghị, đề xuất, gợi ý
examples: ▪ ‘Why not ask Dad?’ he suggested.
▪ I’m not sure which is the best wine to order. What would you suggest?

children.name: suggest (that)
examples: ▪ Sarah suggested that I should apply for this job.

children.name: recommend
children.definition: to advise sb to do sth, especially when you have special knowledge of a particular subject or situation: khyến cáo , khuyến nghị
examples: ▪ The Forsyth Report recommended stricter supervision of the trade in live animals.
▪ Ask your tour guide to recommend the best places to eat.

children.name: recommend that
examples: ▪ Doctors recommend that all children be immunized against polio and tuberculosis.

children.name: recommend doing sth
examples: ▪ I would always recommend buying a good quality bicycle rather than a cheap one.

children.name: strongly recommend
examples: ▪ I strongly recommend that you get your brakes checked before you go on a long drive.

children.name: give advice
children.definition: giveadvice to advise sb about a problem or subject, especially sth that they have asked you about: cho lời khuyên
examples: I’m afraid that’s the only advice I can give you.

children.name: give advice on/about
examples: Ask your bank to give you some advice about special student packages.

children.name: give advice to sb
examples: The centre gives free advice to young people who have drug problems.

children.name: give sb advice
examples: Can you give me some advice? I’m thinking of buying a computer.

children.name: urge
children.definition: to strongly advise sb to do sth because you think it is very important: thôi thúc, giục giã
examples: The company’s bosses are urging full cooperation with the trade union.

children.name: urge sb to do sth
examples: Police are urging drivers not to come into London this weekend.

children.name: urge that
examples: He gave copies of the report to all those present at the meeting, urging that they read and digest its contents.

children.name: you should/ought to
children.definition: you should do something/you ought to do something spoken:

children.name: bạn nên làm gì đó/ bạn phải làm gì đó
examples: ▪ You should go to the doctor with that cough.
Bạn nên đến bác sĩ với bệnh ho này.
▪ I think you should stay here until you’ve sobered up.
Tôi nghĩ bạn nên ở lại đây cho đến khi bạn tỉnh rượu.
▪ That new restaurant’s great -- you really ought to try it.
Nhà hàng đó thật tuyệt vời -- bạn thật sự phải thử đến đó.
▪ Do you know what you ought to do? You ought to tell her exactly what you think of her.
Bạn có biết bạn nên làm gì không? Bạn nên nói cho cô ấy chính xác những gì bạn nghĩ về cô ấy.

children.name: if I were you
children.definition: say this when you are giving someone friendly advice:
examples: nếu tôi là bạncách nói dùng cái này khi bạn muốn cho ai lời khuyên
▪ I wouldn’t do that if I were you.
Tôi sẽ không làm điều đó nếu tôi là bạn.
▪ Here’s your money -- if I were you I’d put it in the bank right now.
Đây là tiền của bạn -- Nếu tôi là bạn tôi sẽ nạp chúng vào ngân hàng ngay bây giờ
if I were you
B1 used when you give someone advice:
If I were you, I'd probably go.
I think I'd take the money if I were you.

children.name: you 'd better off
children.definition: you’d be better off spoken say this when you are advising someone how to do something in a better way:

children.name: tốt hơn bạn nêncách nói dùng cái này khi bạn đang khuyên ai đó về cách làm điều gì đó một cách tốt hơn
examples: ▪ The ferry takes about eight hours! You’d be better off going by plane.
Đi phà sẽ mất khoảng 8 tiếng đồng hồ! Tốt hơn bạn nên đi bằng máy bay.
▪ I think you’d be better off using a knife rather than scissors for that job.
Tôi nghĩ tốt hơn bạn nên sử dụng một con dao thay vì cái kéo để làm công việc này.

children.name: take my advice
children.definition: say this when you think that someone should do something because you know from your own experience how unpleasant or difficult something can be:

children.name: nghe tôi đi, nghe kinh nghiệm của tôi đi cách nói dùng cái này khi bạn nghĩ ai đó nên làm điều gì vì bạn biết điều đóthông qua chính kinh nghiệm của bạn điều đó có thể khó khăn và xấu cỡ nào
examples: ▪ Take my advice - don’t go into teaching unless you’re absolutely committed.
Hãy nghe tôi đi - đừng đi dạy nếu bạn không thật sự tận tâm.
▪ Divorces are a nightmare. Take my advice and stay single.
Ly hôn là một cơn ác mộng. Hãy nghe lời khuyên của tôi và sống độc thân đi.

children.name: take it from me
children.definition: say this when you are telling someone that they should trust the advice you are giving them because it is based on your personal experience:
examples: lấy kinh nghiệm từ tôi nàycách nói dùng cái này khi bạn đang nói cho ai biết rằng họ nên tin tưởng lời khuyên của của bạn vì điều đó dựa trên kinh nghiệm của bản thân bạn
▪ Take it from me, you’ll regret it if you waste your time at school.
Lấy kinh nghiệm từ tôi này, bạn sẽ hối hận nếu bạn lãng phí thời gian ở trường học
▪ Love affairs with colleagues never work out -- take it from me.
Mấy chuyện yêu đương với đồng nghiệp sẽ không bao giờ thành công đâu -- nghe kinh nghiệm từ tôi này.
take it from me(alsotakemyword for it)
accept that what I say is true, because I know or have experienced it
_It won't work - take it from me.

children.name: make sure (that) you
children.definition: ...  spoken say this when you do not want someone to make a mistake, for example by forgetting to do something or losing something:

children.name: đảm bảo (rằng) bạn ...cách nói dùng cách nói này khi bạn không muốn ai đó mắc lỗi, ví dụ như quên làm điều gì hay bỏ quên cái gì
examples: ▪ Make sure that you take your passport.
Hãy đảm bảo rằng bạn có đem theo hộ chiếu của mình.
▪ Make sure you lock all the doors and windows at night.
Hãy đảm bảo rằng bạn đã khóa hết tất cả các cửa và cửa sổ vào ban đêm.

children.name: the best thing is to
children.definition: ...  spoken say this when you are telling someone what you think the best way of dealing with a particular situation is, based on your own experience:

children.name: Tốt hơn hết là... cách nói dùng cái này khi bạn đang khuyên ai những gì bạn nghĩ là cách tốt nhất để đối phó trong một tình huống nhất định, dựa trên chính kinh nghiệm của bạn
examples: ▪ The best thing is to just ignore her. She’ll soon take the hint.
Cách tốt nhất là chỉ cần mặc cô ấy đi.Cô ấy sẽ sớm nhận ra gợi ý thôi.

children.name: a word of advice
children.definition: ...  spoken say this especially when you are warning someone to be careful about something:

children.name: một lời khuyêncách nói dùng cách nói này nhất là khi bạn đang cảnh báo ai nên cẩn thận về điều gì
examples: ▪ A word of advice: when you’re at the interview don’t mention that you used to work in a bar.
Lời khuyên chân thành: khi bạn đang trong buổi phỏng vấn đừng đề cập đến chuyện bạn từng làm trong vũ trường.

children.name: on no account
children.definition: /not on any account  formal use this when you are strongly advising someone not to do something because it would be dangerous or stupid:
examples: không vì bất cứ lí do nào [trạng từ] nghĩa trang trọng sử dụng từ này khi bạn đang ra sức khuyên ai đó không làm điều gì vì điều đó sẽ rất nguy hiểm và ngu xuẩn
▪ On no account should you attempt this exercise if you’re pregnant.
Không vì bất cứ lí do nào để bạn cố thử bài tập này nếu bạn đang có thai.
not on any account
không vì bất cứ lí do nào
▪ You shouldn’t sign the contract unless you are sure you understand it. Not on any account.
Bạn không nên ký hợp một hợp đồng nếu bạn không chắc bạn hiểu rõ nó. Dù cho trong bất kì trường hợp nào.

children.name: you would do well to do sth
children.definition: you’d be well advised to do something/you would do well to do something especially written use this when you arestronglyadvising someone to do something, especially because they may have trouble if they do not do it:
examples: bạn thật đúng đắn khi làm gì đó/ bạn sẽ làm tốt nếu bạn làm gì đó đặc biệt dùng trong văn viết dùng cái này khi bạn ra sức khuyên ai làm gì, nhất là vì họ sẽ gặp rắc rối nếu họ không làm theo
▪ Before your interview you’d be well advised to have another look at what you put on the application form
Trước buổi phỏng vấn bạn sẽ thật đúng đắn khi bạn nhìn lại những gì bạn đã đưa vào đơn xin việc.
▪ There are parts of Detroit you’d be well advised to avoid
Có những khu vực của Detroit mà bạn thật đúng đắn khi tránh đến đó.

children.name: sb had better do sth
children.definition: sbhad betterdo sth

children.name: used to give advice or to make a threat
examples: _You'd better (= You should) go home now before the rain starts.
_He'd better pay me back that money he owes me soon,or else.

children.name: take sb's advice
children.definition: take sb’s advice/follow sb’s advice to do what sb advises you to do:

children.name: do what sb says
children.definition: especially spoken to do what someone has told or advised you to do:

children.name: làm theo những gì ai đó bảođặc biệt dùng trong văn nói làm những gì người nào đó bảo hoặc khuyên bạn làm
examples: ▪ If you’d done what I’d said, none of this would have happened.
Nếu bạn làm theo những gì tôi khuyên thì đã không có chuyện gì này xảy ra.

children.name: listen to
children.definition: to do what someone advises you to do, especially because you respect them and trust their judgement:

children.name: làm những gì ai đó khuyên bạn nên làm, nhất là vì bạn tôn trọng và tin tưởng quyết định của họ
examples: ▪ You tell him Dad - I’m sure he’ll listen to you.
▪ Bob warned us about this. I wish I’d listened to him.

children.name: on sb’s advice
children.definition: on somebody’s advice/on the advice of somebody  if you do something on someone’s advice, you do it because they have advised you to do it: theo lời khuyên của ai
examples: ▪ On her doctor’s advice, she took a few days off work.
▪ He decided not to take the exam, on the advice of his professor.

children.name: sb' advice about what you should do
advice
children.definition: an opinion you give someone about what they should do:
examples: You should have followed my advice.
advice on/about
advice on saving energy
I need some advice about my computer.
on sb’s advice
On her doctor’s advice(= because her doctor advised her )Smith decided to take early retirement.

children.name: give sb some advice
examples: My father once gave me some useful advice.|The scheme has given advice and training to scores of youngsters taking part.

children.name: get some advice
examples: I decided to get some advice from a specialist.

children.name: ask sb’s advice
examples: Can I ask your advice about something?

children.name: ask for advice
examples: If in doubt, always ask for advice.

children.name: take/follow sb’s advice
children.definition: alsoact on sb’s adviceformal
examples: (= do what someone advises you to do )He followed his doctor’s advice and went on a low-fat diet.|The king acted on his advice and ordered his soldiers to get ready for battle.

children.name: listen to sb’s advice
children.definition: alsoheed sb’s adviceformal
examples: (= pay attention to someone’s advice )I wish I had listened to her advice.

children.name: ignore/disregard sb’s advice
children.definition: not do what someone tells you
examples: The accident happened because she ignored their advice.

children.name: go/turn to somebody for advice
examples: People often go to him for advice about their problems.

children.name: seek advice
children.definition: try to get some advice
examples: If you have any of these symptoms you should seek urgent advice.

children.name: offer advice
examples: They can offer advice to those who wish to quit drinking.

children.name: pass on some advice
children.definition: give someone advice that you have learned or been given
examples: Readers can pass on advice about gardening.

children.name: good/excellent/useful/helpful
examples: The book is full of good advice.

children.name: sound
children.definition: sensible
examples: I thought that this was sound advice.

children.name: wrong
examples: Unfortunately all the advice they gave me was wrong.

children.name: bad advice
examples: Financial advisors can be fined if they give bad advice to a client.

children.name: practical advice
examples: The programme aims to offer practical advice on healthy eating.

children.name: detailed advice
examples: The website gives detailed advice about making bombs.

children.name: professional/expert/specialist advice
examples: It’s advisable to get professional advice before starting any building work.

children.name: legal/medical/financial etc advice
examples: Good legal advice can be expensive.

children.name: independent/impartial advice
children.definition: from someone who is not involved and will not get an advantage
examples: The banks claim to offer independent financial advice.

children.name: conflicting advice
children.definition: very different opinions about what you should do
examples: I’ve asked several people, and they’ve all given me conflicting advice.

children.name: a piece of advice
children.definition: alsoa bit of adviceinformal
examples: Let me give you a piece of advice.

children.name: a word of advicespoken
children.definition: used when advising someone what to do
examples: A word of advice: look at the small print in the contract very carefully.

children.name: an advice centre/service/desk/bureau
examples: They offer a 24-hour advice service to customers.

children.name: tip
children.definition: a simple but useful piece of advice about how to do sth more easily or effectively: mẹo
examples: Here’s a good ti if you spill red wine on your carpet, pour salt on it to remove it.
tip on/for
This week's magazine has some tips on healthy eating.
handy tip(= useful tip )
handy tips for decorating a small flat
gardening tips

children.name: give somebody a tip
examples: He gave me some tips on how to improve my game.

children.name: pass on a tip
examples: The writer passes on many tips that she has learned over the years.

children.name: follow a tip
examples: To keep your bike in good condition, follow these simple tips.

children.name: pick up a tip
examples: If you listen to the show, you’ll pick up some really useful gardening tips.

children.name: a good/useful/helpful/handy tip
examples: Go to their website to find useful tips on buying and selling a home.

children.name: a simple tip
examples: He has some simple tips for saving money when you're at the supermarket.

children.name: cooking tips
examples: Most recipes come with added cooking tips.

children.name: gardening tips
examples: Marie was always willing to share her gardening tips.

children.name: beauty tips
examples: The article contains some useful beauty tips.

children.name: safety tips
examples: Ensure the safety of your family with a few simple safety tips from the Fire Service.

children.name: recommendation
children.definition: official advice about what to do, usually given by an expert or a group of people who have studied the matter: khuyến nghị, khuyến cáo
examples: We will review the case andmakearecommendationto the client.
recommendation for
recommendations for school reform
recommendation of
the main recommendations of the report
recommendation that
We are making no recommendation that children should use Standard English.
recommendation to do something
a recommendation to replace the existing system

children.name: guidance
children.definition: advice about what to do in your job, your education, or your private life - use this about advice you get from sb whose job is to advise and help people: hướng dẫn, chỉ dẫn
examples: practical guidance and support for people working abroad
guidance on/about
I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
under sb’s expert guidance
I was looking forward to working under her expert guidance.
parental/spiritual etc guidance
Children need moral guidance.
give guidance
Your teacher can give you guidance on choosing a career and writing a job application.

children.name: counsellingBritish /counselingAmerican
children.definition: advice and support given by a specially trained person who can help people with personal problems or people who have had a very unpleasant experience: lời tư vấn
examples: Victims of violent crimes often need counseling.
group/bereavement/debt etc counselling
a debt counselling service
counselling for
She’s been undergoing counseling for depression.
The college will provide counselling for students who have problems with alcohol or drugs.

children.name: hint
children.definition: a useful piece of advice about how to do sth: “gợi ý”
examples: Could yougiveus a hintabouthow to do this exercise, please?
helpful/handy hints
This recipe book is full ofhandyhints.
hint on/about
helpful hints on looking after house plants

children.name: sb who give advice as a job
adviserBritish /advisorAmerican
children.definition: sb whose job is to give advice, especially in business, law, or politics: cố vấn
examples: financial/legal/careers etc adviser
▪ Talk to an independent financial adviser before you invest your money.
adviser on
▪ the Prime Minister’s personal adviser on economic affairs
adviser to sb
▪ She’s been appointed as scientific advisor to the President.
advisory[usually attri] existing for the purpose of giving advice:tư vấn, cố vấn
▪ The Science Council is mainly an advisory body.
▪ I will be present at committee meetings, but purely in an advisory capacity.

children.name: consultant
children.definition: sb who gives special technical advice to companies or other organizations: cố vấn
examples: He’s left his job as a computer programmer and is working as a consultant for a German firm.

children.name: a political/financial etc consultant
examples: A team of political consultants shaped his election campaign.

children.name: an outside/independent consultant
children.definition: one who does not belong to your organization
examples: An educational programme was planned by outside consultants.

children.name: a management consultant
children.definition: one who advises a company how to improve its management
examples: The company employed management consultants to help with their strategy for the future.

children.name: a recruitment consultant
children.definition: one who helps companies find suitable staff
examples: Recruitment consultants say that employers are reducing the number of new staff.

children.name: a marketing consultant
children.definition: one who gives advice on how to advertise and sell a product

children.name: a public relations/PR consultant
children.definition: one who advises an organization on how to relate well to the public

children.name: an image consultant
children.definition: one who advises people how to improve their style or appearance
examples: The new Prime Minister was advised to see an image consultant.

children.name: a fashion consultant
children.definition: one who advises people on what to wear
examples: It would be great to have your own fashion consultant.

children.name: act as a consultant
children.definition: be a consultant on a particular project
examples: He acted as a historical consultant on the film.

children.name: work as a consultant
examples: We have 170 staff working as computer consultants to clients.

children.name: employ a consultant
examples: We sometimes employ consultants to help with marketing.

children.name: hire/engage a consultant
children.definition: start to employ one
examples: The company hired an outside consultant to review staffing levels.

children.name: bring in a consultant
children.definition: start to use one
examples: Consultants were brought in to examine the building.

children.name: consultant on
examples: Booth is a consultant on language with one of the national press agencies.

children.name: counsellorBritish /counselorAmerican
children.definition: sb who gives professional advice and emotional support to people, especially about personal problems: chuyên gia tư vấn, tư vấn viên
examples: Are you seeing a counsellor?

children.name: a student/family counsellor
children.definition: helping students or families with problems
examples: Student counsellors say there's a lot of pressure at college these days.

children.name: a debt/stress etc counsellor
children.definition: helping with debt, stress etc problems
examples: A debt counsellor has been helping the family.

children.name: a marriage
children.definition: guidance
examples: counsellor(= helping with marriage problems )You should talk to a marriage counsellor about your problem.

children.name: a school counsellor
children.definition: working with the students at a school
examples: I worked for three years as a school counsellor.

children.name: a professional/trained counsellor
examples: Seek help from a professional counsellor if things go wrong.

children.name: see a counsellor
children.definition: go to a counsellor for help
examples: Her doctor recommended that she should see a counsellor.

children.name: guru
children.definition: sb who is highly respected within their area of work, and to whom people go for advice: cố vấn uy tín, quân sư
examples: Peter Drucker, the management guru, has just published a new book.
It soon became apparent that Colin was the guru of the whole department.

children.name: focus group
children.definition: a group of ordinary people who are brought together and asked for their opinions about a particular subject or product by a company, political party etc, in order to help them plan what to do or produce in the future: nhóm người được thăm dò ý kiến, nhóm tập trung
examples: The government’s excessive use of focus groups to sound out public opinion has come under a lot of criticism.
A focus group gave its responses to the proposed advertising campaign.

children.name: think-tank
children.definition: a committee of people with experience in a particular subject that an organization or government establishes to produce ideas and give advice: nhóm chuyên gia cố vấn
examples: a right-wing political think-tank

children.name: ask sb’s advice
children.definition: to ask sb to advise you about sth: xin ai lời khuyên
examples: Can I ask your advice? I need to find somewhere to stay in London.

children.name: ask sb’s advice on/about
examples: I always ask my brother’s advice about computers.

children.name: seek advice
children.definition: to ask sb to advise you or to try to find sb to advise you, especially sb who has special or professional knowledge: tìm lời khuyên
examples: seek advice from sb
The best thing to do is to seek advice from an expert.
seek sb’s advice on
Carla sought her grandmother’s advice on all personal matters

children.name: take adviceget/obtain advice/British
children.definition: xin lời khuyên, ý kiến
examples: get legal/medical/professionaletc adviceto ask sb who has special knowledge to advise you about a problem that you cannot deal with by yourself:
▪ If the debt is not paid within seven days, we will take legal advice.
▪ Pregnant women should get medical advice before taking any kind of drug
get legal etc advice on
▪ She had told her employers that she would be getting professional advice on her rights.

children.name: consult
children.definition: to ask for information or advice from sb because it is their job to know sth: xin tư vấn, tham khảo ý kiến ai
examples: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.

children.name: consult sb about sth
examples: An increasing number of people are consulting their accountants about the tax laws.

children.name: consult with
examples: I need to consult with my lawyer.
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually sayasksomeone, orseesomeone, rather thanconsultsomeone:
You need toaskyour lawyer.
I think you shouldgo and seeyour doctor.

children.name: consultation
children.definition: a discussion in which people who are affected by or involved in sth can give their opinions: hội đàm , hội ý

children.name: hold a consultation
examples: Further consultations will be held with local residents.

children.name: begin a consultation
examples: French and German officials began consultations with officials from the other four nations.

children.name: require consultationformal
children.definition: need consultation
examples: Any decision on military action would require consultation.

children.name: public consultation
children.definition: asking for for ordinary people's views
examples: The first public consultations considered environmental and health issues.

children.name: full consultation
children.definition: including all the details of something
examples: No decision will be made until there has been full consultation with farmers.

children.name: prior consultation
children.definition: happening before something is done
examples: New educational policies should be based on prior consultation with teachers.

children.name: proper consultation
examples: Has there been proper consultation with the local communities?

children.name: further consultation
examples: It is recommended that further consultation should take place.

children.name: close consultation
children.definition: in which people, groups etc discuss something carefully together
examples: The changes followed close consultation with government officials.

children.name: wide/widespread/extensive consultation
children.definition: involving a lot of people, groups etc
examples: Strong recommendations were made after wide consultation.

children.name: joint consultation
children.definition: involving two different groups
examples: Committees can be used for joint consultation between employers and employees.

children.name: formal consultation
children.definition: organized in a formal way
examples: Better methods of formal consultation are needed.

children.name: a consultation paper/document
children.definition: a formal report on a subject that needs to be discussed
examples: He produced a consultation document on public transport proposals for the city.

children.name: a consultation exercise
children.definition: an activity that involves getting people's opinions on something
examples: The public consultation exercise was undertaken to gauge public reaction.

children.name: consultation with
examples: The decision was reached after consultation with parents and teachers.

children.name: consultation between
examples: He’s calling for urgent consultations between the government and the oil industry to resolve the problem.

children.name: in consultation with sb
examples: The plans were drawn up in consultation with engineers.

children.name: the consultation process/periodan eight-week consultation process
consultation
children.definition: a meeting with a professional person, especially a doctor, for advice or treatment:
examples: A follow-up consultation was arranged for two weeks’ time.

children.name: consultation with
examples: After consultations with our accountants, we've decided how to cut costs within the company.
